description: Numbers n such that prime(n) == 4 (mod n).
mathematica: NextPrim[n_] := Block[{k = n + 1}, While[ !PrimeQ[k], k++ ]; k]; p = 1; Do[ If[ Mod[p = NextPrim[p], n] == 4, Print[n]], {n, 1, 10^9}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 18 2004 *)
prog: (Sage)def A023146(max) :....terms = []....p = 2....for n in xrange(1, max+1) :........if (p - 4) % n == 0 : terms.append(n)........p = next_prime(p)....return termsend # Eric M. Schmidt, Feb 05 2013
author: _David W. Wilson_
extensions: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 18 2004
